entry.def: Chemistry is the scientific study of the structure of substances and of the way that they react with other substances.

entry.tran: (物质的)化学组成，化学成分，化学反应
entry.def: The chemistry of an organism or a material is the chemical substances that make it up and the chemical reactions that go on inside it.

example.ex: We have literally altered the chemistry of our planet's atmosphere...
example.tran: 我们确实改变了地球大气层的化学构成。

example.ex: If the supply of vitamins and minerals in the diet is inadequate, this will result in changes in body chemistry.
example.tran: 如果饮食中的维生素和矿物质含量太低，将会引起人体化学结构的变化。

entry.def: If you say that there is chemistry between two people, you mean that is obvious they are attracted to each other or like each other very much.

example.ex: ...the extraordinary chemistry between Ingrid and Bogart...
example.tran: 英格丽和鲍嘉之间的情意绵绵

example.ex: Janis and I became friends but we were never close. The chemistry wasn't there.
example.tran: 我和贾妮斯成了朋友，可我们从未走得太近，没有那种感觉。

means.word_mean: 1. the science of matter; the branch of the natural sciences dealing with the composition of substances and their properties and reactions
2. the way two individuals relate to each other;

sentences.sentence: "their chemistry was wrong from the beginning -- they hated each other"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 集合名词,通常放在一个完整的单词后面,表"整体"; 2. 表名词,通常放在一个完整的单词后面,表"场地,物等"; 3. 表名词,通常放在一个完整的单词后面,表"行业,学科"; 4. 表名词,通常放在一个完整的单词后面,表"状态,性质"

stems_affixes.word_buile: citizen市民,公民+ry整体→n.全体公民
gent绅士,假绅士+ry整体→n.贵族们
peasant农夫,乡下人+ry整体→n.农民[总称]

stems_affixes.value_cn: 铸造,翻砂,铸工厂,玻璃厂,铸造厂
stems_affixes.word_buile: found制造+ry场地,物等→n.铸造,翻砂,铸工厂,玻璃厂,铸造厂

stems_affixes.value_cn: 洗衣房[店];待洗衣物,所洗衣物
stems_affixes.word_buile: laund洗+ry场地,物等→n.洗衣房[店];待洗衣物,所洗衣物
lor+ry场地,物等→n.卡车,铁路货车
quar采石,来自square+ry场地,物等→n.猎物,追求物
pant+ry场地,物等→n.食品柜,餐具室
forest森林+ry行业,学科→n.林产,森林地
husband丈夫+ry行业,学科→丈夫干农活→务农
palmist看手相的人+ry行业,学科→n.相手术
artist艺术家,画家+ry表名词→n.艺术技巧
handit匪徒+ry状态,性质→n.盗贼行为,贼党
mimic模仿者+ry状态,性质→n.模仿,[动物等]拟态伪装
parquet镶木地板+ry状态,性质→n.镶木地板艺术或图案
rival竞争者,对手+ry状态,性质→n.竞争,对抗

jushi.english: Professor of science at Harvard, he won the 1965 Nobel Prize for chemistry.
jushi.chinese: 他作为哈佛大学的理学教授获得了1965年的诺贝尔化学奖。

jushi.english: He reckoned without chemistry and human ingenuity when he predicted the man sooner or later faced starvation.
jushi.chinese: 当他预言人类迟早要挨饿时,他没有考虑到化学和人的创造性。

jushi.english: Chemistry was her favourite subject at school.
